body.title: How to run Castor JDO's CTF suite

section.title: Overview
section.p: Castor JDO has a JUnit test suite that is used to test various functional areas, and to give developers/committers some reassurance when changing the codebase.

section.title: Intended Audience
section.p: Anyone who wants to run the CTF test suite. This document outlines the basic steps to get people unfamiliar with this area started.
Our example describes the use of command-line tools for a UNIX system.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: Anybody wishing to run the CTF test suite should have access to the source code of Castor. This can be obtained in one of the following ways:

ul.li: Download the sources distribution from the download page
download the latest snapshot from CVS from (see links on the bottom left corner): here
Check out the latest code from CVS into your prefered developement environment. For instructions on this task, take a look here

section.title: Steps
section.p: Once you have obtained the Castor sources in one of the ways highlighted above, here is how to proceed. In general, more information about how to execute the CTF test suite can be found here.
From a command line (e.g a shell), please execute the following commands to run the test suite against mySQL (where <castor-root> points to the directory where you installed the Castor sources:
section.code-panel: cd <castor-root>/bin build clean build tests test castor.mysql
section.p: To execute just one of the many tests of of the complete test suite, please change this to:
section.code-panel: cd <castor-root>/bin build clean build tests test castor.mysql.TC01
